IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Nemaha Valley Community Hospital provides an acute care hospital to the surrounding area.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Nemaha Valley Community Hospital is dedicated to providing quality health care and other related services in a compassionate manner sufficient to meet the primary health needs of its patrons within the scope of its resources and staff.
IRS990.Description: Nemaha Valley Community Hospital provides healthcare treatment to its patients.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Net assets released from restrictions used for operations: -31684. Temporarily restricted contributions: 123782. Restricted Investment Income: 7674. Intercomany Transfers: 50000. Temporarily restricted assets released for property and equipment: -103174. Unrestricted assets used for property and equipment: 103174.
Rental expenses that offset rental income: 2174.
Rental expenses that offset rental income: 2174.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: Nemaha Valley Community Hospital provides for accounts receivable that could become uncollectible in the future by establishing an allowance to reduce the carrying value of such receivables to their estimated net realizable value. Nemaha Valley Community Hospital estimates this allowance based on the aging of its accounts receivable and its historical collection experience for each type of payor.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: Part III, Line 8: The Hospital provides service to all patients in their service area, regardless of the patient's ability to pay, and any shortfall absorbed by the Hospital is a benefit to the community.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: Part III, Line 9b: Nemaha Valley Community Hospital will make every effort to get correct financial and billing information and educate patients on charity programs and payment options.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: Part VI, Line 2: The Hospital receives feedback from community members regarding services currently offered and potential availability of services not offered. The Hospital also discusses the service needs of the community with the medical staff and board of trustees, who are in tune with the needs of the patients.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: Part VI, Line 3: Notification associated with patient encounter.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: Part VI, Line 4: The community being served consists of approximately 2,000 residents. The average household income is $41,827. 7.1% of the community residents live below federal poverty level, and 1.9% of the community residents live below 50% of the federal poverty level. Neighboring hospitals are located in Sabetha, Pawnee County, NE, and Hiawatha. They are approximately 15, 20, and 28 miles away respectively.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: Part VI, Line 6: The Hospital notifies the public in quarterly newsletters about services available at the hospital. The Hospital offers periodic diabetic educational programs and education programs for expectant mothers. The Hospital uses all excess funds to maintain and improve Hospital facilities and patient services.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: To refund notes payable and construction cost for an addition to Hospital

LoanTable.PurposeOfLoan: Assist with transition from medical school

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The CEO salary and compensation is approved by the hospital's board.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Fundraising for the benefit of Nemaha Valley Community Hospital
